fields.title: Contribute
fields.content:
Curriculum

If you're interested in contributing to the existing curriculum, the repository is on GitHub at github.com/mechanicalgirl/young-coders-tutorial. Pull requests with changes to the curriculum are always welcome, but may not necessarily be incorporated.

What we need currently:

  • help converting the beginner tutorial to a Jupyter (formerly IPython) notebook
  • translations of the tutorial into languages other than English

Donations

Unfortunately, we're not set up to take donations yet. For now, the best way you can help financially is to contribute to the Python Software Foundation. Your donations to the PSF will help to finance lots of wonderful programs and classes for Python students around the world.

Stay In Touch!

If you organize a class in your community, let us know about it! We'll be happy to promote your event through Facebook and Twitter.

You can also sign up below for the Let's Learn Python mailing list to keep up to date on what's going on with the site and learn about all the new developments on the way!

fields.title: About
fields.content:
Welcome to Let's Learn Python!

This web site {contains} information about both learning and teaching beginner Python.

The curriculum in the Learn section is based on a class taught annually at PyCon North America. While it is aimed at students aged 12 and up, it's appropriate for beginners at any age - including adults.

The Teach section features a guide that any Python developer can use to organize and teach a class in their own community. We provide information about equipment, materials, financing, and more - including notes on teaching for the first time if you don't have any prior experience!

In the coming months, we'll be formalizing this teaching guide and adding organizer tools that will make it easier than ever to plan a class in your town!
